title: Deep Breathing
description: A simple breathing exercise to reduce stress and anxiety.
instructions: Find a comfortable position sitting or lying down.
Place one hand on your chest and the other on your abdomen.
Breathe in slowly through your nose, feeling your abdomen expand.
Hold your breath for a moment.
Exhale slowly through your mouth.
Repeat for 5 minutes, focusing on your breath.

title: Progressive Muscle Relaxation
description: Tense and relax different muscle groups to release tension.
instructions: Lie down in a comfortable position.
Start with your feet. Tense the muscles as tightly as you can for 5 seconds.
Relax your feet completely and notice the difference.
Move up to your calves, then thighs, and continue through your body.
End with your facial muscles, tensing and relaxing each group.
Take a moment to enjoy the sensation of complete relaxation.

title: Guided Visualization
description: Mental imagery exercise to promote relaxation and reduce stress.
instructions: Find a quiet place where you won't be disturbed.
Close your eyes and take a few deep breaths.
Imagine yourself in a peaceful place, like a beach or forest.
Engage all your senses - what do you see, hear, smell, feel?
Spend time exploring this peaceful place in your mind.
When ready, slowly bring your awareness back to the present.

title: Mindful Meditation
description: Focus on the present moment to calm your mind.
instructions: Sit in a comfortable position with your back straight.
Close your eyes and focus on your breathing.
Notice the sensation of air entering and leaving your body.
When your mind wanders, gently bring your attention back to your breath.
Continue for 10 minutes, being present in the moment.
Slowly open your eyes when you're ready to finish.

title: Body Scan
description: Systematically focus on each part of your body to release tension.
instructions: Lie down in a comfortable position.
Close your eyes and take a few deep breaths.
Bring your attention to your feet, noticing any sensations.
Slowly move your attention up through your body, part by part.
Notice any areas of tension and consciously relax them.
When you reach your head, take a moment to feel your whole body.

title: 5-4-3-2-1 Grounding Technique
description: A quick exercise to ground yourself during anxiety or stress.
instructions: Look around and name 5 things you can see.
Notice 4 things you can feel or touch.
Acknowledge 3 things you can hear.
Identify 2 things you can smell.
Name 1 thing you can taste.
Take a deep breath and notice how you feel more grounded.
